newsitem.title: BELGIUM: SOLVAC SETS SECOND INTERIM DIVIDEND.
newsitem.headline: SOLVAC SETS SECOND INTERIM DIVIDEND.

text.p: Belgian holding company Solvac, the main shareholder of Belgium's largest chemicals group Solvay SA , said on Friday it would pay a second interim dividend of 34 francs net per ordinary share on March 6, 1997.
It said in a statement that the net dividend per reduced tax (VVPR) share would amount to 38.53 francs.
Solvac said the second interim dividend represented the balance of the total dividend payment for the 1996 financial year.
It said the shares will be negotiated ex-dividend on the Brussels bourse from February 3.
The total of both interim dividends amounted to 84 francs net per ordinary share, up 8.9 percent from a year earlier. Total dividend for VVPR shares rose seven percent to 95.2 francs.
